definition: to take part in an election/to run for office

sentences.english: The candidate's campaign was attended with too much ballyhoo .
sentences.chinese: 这个候选人的竞选活动致力于太多的大举造势。

sentences.english: And today his campaign expects more super delegates will be announcing their support for Obama. Mara Liasson, NPR News, Washington.
sentences.chinese: 今天在竞选中他期待更多超级代表的选票。

sentences.english: Mr. Ayers is not involved in my campaign.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔斯没有参与我的任何竞选活动。
学期的班干部竞选也开始了。

sentences.english: There was more  name-calling in the campaign for senator than I ever heard before.
sentences.chinese: 在那次参议员竞选中相互谩骂之多是我闻所未闻的。

sentences.english: He is challenging for the coach in the Football Club.
sentences.chinese: 他正在竞选，争当足球俱乐部的教练。

sentences.english: The officials said there were campaign violations.
sentences.chinese: 官员称，该党的竞选有违规行为。

sentences.english: I'm planning to run for the school board.
sentences.chinese: 我打算竞选联合校董事会董事。

sentences.english: Well, now he'stalking about running again for governor in 2010. He also said he'slooking forward to spending less time with his family.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，现在他又在要竞选2010年州长了。

sentences.english: Former governor of Utah, Jon Huntsman, is running for president.
sentences.chinese: 前犹他州长洪博培宣布竞选总统。

sentences.english: The man threw leaflets for a write-in campaign for mayor before police pulled him up and arrested him.
sentences.chinese: 这名男子一直在朝下扔传单，为市长的竞选活动造势。

sentences.english: Second, I expect the McCain campaign to double down on the executive experience issue.
sentences.chinese: 第二，我期待麦凯恩竞选兼任行政经验问题长官。

sentences.english: The 54-year-old had promised during the campaign to serve out his term as mayor.
sentences.chinese: 当年54岁的朱立伦在竞选中承诺将服满市长任期。

sentences.english: If you don't pay people, they are more committed to the cause.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不付钱给这些人，他们就对竞选更加投入。

sentences.english: Ms Fernández used the world financial crisis as an excuse for bringing forward the election.
sentences.chinese: 法娜赫姿女士利用世界金融危机作为借口参加竞选。

definition: to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
Hillary (name)/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
pinyin: Xi1 la1 li3 · Ke4 lin2 dun4

definition: Donald Trump (1946-), American business magnate, US president 2017-
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
